div.font:
We need to install
individual O.S for
each VM separately.
And it will take almost
more than 2 GB of RAM
of Host OS.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 119px; margin-left: 6px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 17px; font-family: "Lucida Console"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

font.span:
This 4GB ram will not
be used by any other

VM even if this VM1
is not doing any work

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 64px; margin-left: 231px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 17px; font-family: "Lucida Console"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

font.span: Let's say VM 2 needs more than 4 GB

RAM for a particularÂ application to
be run

even if VM 1 is not doing
anything VM1

will not share its RAM
with VM2, means this 4 GB RAM of VM1
font.font: is a type of wastage only in this case

switch.text: Let's say VM 2 needs more than 4 G...
